snippet: The WikiLeaks founder has been holed up in the Ecuadorean Embassy in London since 2012, avoiding extradition to Sweden on a rape accusation.
abstract: Scotland Yard abandons 24-hour monitoring of Ecuadorean Embassy, refuge of Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, who faces threat of extradition to Sweden on rape charges; government reluctantly yields surveillance of Assange as critics decry time and $17 million of taxpayer money spent on effort.
lead_paragraph: The WikiLeaks founder has been holed up in the Ecuadorean Embassy in London since 2012, avoiding extradition to Sweden on a rape accusation.

headline.main: London Police End 24-Hour Watch at Embassy Housing Julian Assange
headline.print_headline: Police End Monitoring of Assange in London
